audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a man expressing enthusiasm and intent to metal detect on a hill, suggesting it may have been a playground for children due to nearby old houses. There is background rustling as he speaks. He then excitedly reports finding silver, specifically a silver Rosy. Someone expresses positive excitement. The first speaker continues with positive enthusiasm. He adds an exclamatory remark about the terrain being steep and wet, mentioning another man is detecting on his butt, possibly due to the slipperiness of the hill. A different man acknowledges that the ground is slippery. The first speaker mentions some dumb ideas work out, then abruptly cuts out. An orchestral piece, sounding tense and suspenseful, is heard.

An adult male speaks, exhibiting a nonchalant tone, about finding "a bunch of clad", a "needle for doing drugs", "some bum stuff," and referring to an alarm clock as his "first relic." Another discovery is announced, an "old Montana license plate," followed by an assessment that its condition is "pretty rough." Finally, the speaker says "Well," without finishing the thought.

The clip starts with a man expressing excitement over finding silver again. He describes it as a "beauty," referring to a beautiful silver ring. He seems to be at the bottom of a hill, where someone used to live and drop things. A man expresses finding some item that has a person on a camel, palm trees, or something similar, he says they will need to clean up the item. The first man responds with "yeah," mentions getting a close-up with the camera, and describes the item as a "weird button," before adding that it's awesome. Laughter follows, and the first man mentions "I love buttons," before stating that's cool. A different man is heard and discusses a lid that seems to be a compact from a makeup case, expressing hope he will be able to clean it up to show a pattern later. Then the first man comments on getting an old hoe, describing it as cool. The same first man then says "now we're talking" then says "look at that thing" and questions "tell me that's not an old gun," seemingly in disbelief, but then notes that it's obviously a toy. The man questions what the other individual thinks of the item. He points out it does not even seem to have a trigger, and he concludes by saying "dude, that's sweet." The sounds of nature are noticeable throughout the audio clip, like rustling and light wind. Someone says "Dewayne's got himself a dog tag here," and expresses hope of getting a date off of it, but concludes that it is toasty and needs cleaning. The first man agrees it will need cleaning and states they will use apple cider vinegar soap to do so.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker expressing surprise at discovering a homestead at the bottom of a mountainside, describing it as "so cool". The scene transitions, with rustling sounds, to another male speaker marveling at finding jewelry, including what appears to be a cross, expressing curiosity about whether it is silver and hoping to clean it up. The audio shifts again, with continued rustling, to a speaker, possibly the same male voice from before, discussing an ornate, possibly old, object, mentioning attempts to capture close-ups. A "drawer pull" is mentioned, deemed less exciting. The clip then features the sound of a bell ringing, followed by a speaker noting "Rogue on the back" and discussing potential details on the bell's surface. The scene transitions again, where a speaker notes finding "relics" and a lipstick case. Finally, the audio features someone exclaiming over finding a "pencil sharpener", followed by someone concluding the search, mentioning the unexpected find of the homestead, and stating an initial expectation of discovering "Indian head pennies." The clip ends with unintelligible speech.

The clip begins with a male speaker announcing a find, "another find at Dinwiddie's, US Marine Corps knife." He then remarks on the location, "That's a weird spot". The male speaker then declares that they have moved to another location. This is followed by a distinct metallic sound.

A male speaker talks about walking over somewhere to see what they can get. He then mentions doing another hill, describing it as similar to something they were doing before. He points out an old neighborhood and mentions having pulled a "Morgan silver dollar and stuff" off this hill before.

The clip begins with a male speaker excitedly exclaiming, "Well, there's my first good one," followed by the description, "looks like a 1930 Wheaty". Next, the same speaker finds something else and notes, "So, I just got some sort of crayon jewelry."  He's unsure what it is, pondering if it's a "pendant or bracelet". The male speaker then calls the item "weird". The next thing that speaker finds is a ".22 shell" with a "marble," and declares, "not bad." The clip then shifts to the sound of a syringe being used. The same speaker comments with "Look at that, that syringe is a high tone." and finishes the thought with a plain "Dang".

The audio clip starts with one male speaker mentioning that he "got a harmonica reed." The male speaker then describes the reed as "a cool relic," comparing it to "a frog." The speaker then says that he wants to "clean that up." Concluding with the exclamation that it is "crazy."

The audio clip begins with one male speaker expressing bemusement or confusion with a chuckle about "what this is". Another male speaker then chimes in to consider the object's potential use, suggesting it could be "like a drawer pull" or a "knob of some kind" noting its shape and "little slot" hinting at a possible stopper function, further adding to the sense of curious speculation, and then expressing "I don't know". After a short pause, a third male speaker enters, also confounded and noting that it is "fancy" and it has a "patent number on it".

The clip begins with a male voice describing an item as "sort of a fastener," in an inquisitive tone. Shortly after, a second male voice starts speaking in a friendly tone, admiring the other two. He remarks "That's cool," after the first speaker states it's fun and presents a pin. The second speaker praises it. The first speaker says they should move along. The second speaker wishes them luck. The clip concludes.

The audio clip starts with a male speaker describing finding a pin that says "Anna Jettick 500 Club," in an excited tone. He pauses, then continues speaking in a thoughtful manner, thinking the pin was gold before discovering a mark. He indicates it's gold-filled. Then, the speaker shares research about Anna Jettick, stating it was a women's shoe company and surmising the pin was for selling the first 500 pairs of shoes, describing it as "a little better than plated". The speaker continues, describing how they would sell shoes out of camper-like vehicles in the 1920s. In the background, there's the distinct sound of a dog lapping up water, followed by the male speaker making a brief sound as though someone heard the dog.

The clip starts with a male speaker, sounding tired, who remarks "well that was a lot of hillside hunting, I'm whipped". He then hopes the listeners enjoyed it and says "see you on the next one". Shortly after his speech concludes, the clip transitions into a dramatic-sounding musical piece, suggestive of a trailer, which is possibly orchestral in nature.
